ai.summary: A 14.2 km moderate section of the Green Chain Walk in the UK, offering a mix of scenic coastal and parkland scenery with gentle to moderate elevation. Suitable for hikers comfortable with longer day walks and a steady pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of surfaces: well-made footpaths, compacted gravel, grassy tracks, some steps, and occasional muddy or uneven sections. The route may include urban sections as well as rural and coastal segments, with variable footing and potential wind exposure.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for 14.2 km with variable UK weather. Check local conditions and daylight hours. If coastal parts are included, be mindful of tides and sea spray. Wear sturdy footwear, bring a waterproof layer, enough water and energy snacks, a map or GPS, and a small first-aid kit. Stay on marked paths, watch for other pedestrians and cyclists, and inform someone of your route and ETA. In exposed sections, prepare for wind and slippery surfaces.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Headlamp or flashlight (for potential late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October), when daylight is longer and conditions are milder; winter hiking is possible but weather and daylight are more variable.

seo.title: Green Chain Walk Section 5 – 14.2 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore a 14.2 km moderate section of the Green Chain Walk in the UK. Terrain overview, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for this leg.
